comment: Attendance Isn't Mandatory. Don't even bother taking notes in class, cause the stuff she claims will come out in the test never comes out. Her test is sooo hard, you would have to read the textbook and lecture slides in order to pass her tests. Don't take this class unless it is your  only option.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Online Savvy

comment: The lectures are super laid-back as we just go through her Powerpoint. The class moves quickly, and there is quite a bit of reading for homework. Exams are 40 questions each. They are difficult. You have to study; it's impossible to "wing it." Overall, the teacher is extremely sweet, helpful, and she explains things very well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I had this professor m very first semester at college. attendance is not mandatory as long as you complete the weekly assignments. she drops one of each at the end of the semester and there is no final. beware because she does use lockdown browser on exams so it is important you know the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: This is probably my favorite class ever. Her lectures were super easy to understand, the textbook was not lengthy or hard to understand, and really easy quizes/exams if you attend lectures and read your textbook. No other assignments except you have to get 3 SONA points which you can do fairly easy. I would definitely recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I love this class. It's all notes everyday however lots of the reading and notes you have to do outside of class. She's entertaining and every exam you can get bonus points. She drops your lowest quiz and exam. Not really any assignments outside of tests but they're not too hard. Exams require lockdown/webcam. Does a great job reviewing material
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's really a good professor. The only bad thing I would say is we had to do most of our reading during our "online" portion of class. So if a chapter had 10 sections, we'd end up having to read 6-7 on our own. It's hard to discern what's important like that. Otherwise, she's great, and drops a grade in every category at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very easy class if you read the textbook. Discussion post for every test, and most of the quiz answers were on quizlet. I didn't go to many lectures, but made sure I did my work and read over material on my own and did fine in her class. She requires 3 SONA points, which are easy to do so I recommend to do them at the start of the semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: The subject itself is interesting but this professor made me hate this class, she seemed like a nice lady but lazy in a way. Had an error on my test and sent an email just to be told "no one else said anything so nothing I can do." She does drop lowest grades which is nice of her, I just wish she would take time to proof read and be more helpful

Ms. Whittlesey was a good teacher, but she is not lenient at all with late assignments. She does drops one quiz, exam, and discussion post even if you got an A on everything. She's good at giving examples in class and really tries to help you understand the material. Overall she was a pretty decent teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Prof Whittlesey is great and class is manageable. Offers multiple extra point opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The tests are very difficult, requires lots of studying. She does drop a test, a quiz, and a discussion post at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: She is very good  at explaining and thorough with the concepts in class. Gives lots of examples in class for a better perspective on the concept and also gives examples of what kinds of questions will be on the quizzes/exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: the professor was very caring and encouraged to ask questions or any input towards her lectures. there are 5 assignments, 6 quizzes and 5 exams and she drops the lowest of each and all were due at reasonable times. only the exams required lockdown browser and webcam. if you study and do the work, you will do just fine!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Test heavy

comment: She is nice, but you have to have a VERY good understanding of everything in the chapter to make A's on the exams. She uses real world application and it helps, but her tests are extremely specific topics, while we learn a large variety of topics. You need to dedicate a lot of time to her tests. However her discussion posts and quizzes are easy A's
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Lectures were beneficial, as she would use real-life applications to what you're learning, which is seen on the test a lot. The average amount of quizzes and discussion board posts-- she drops one of each at the end of the semester. Made the material easy to understand
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: She was very passionate about the subject. However, you have to really study to make a good grade on the test. You basically, teach yourself the content. It's possible to pass but if you can take a better teacher do it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She is nice, but when presented with multiple questions in one email, she only answers one of the questions. I go to every class and study, and I am still failing because the exams do not match the content. They are incredibly specific compared to the broad concepts we learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She's a nice lady, but I don't think she's a very good teacher. Going to class was kind of pointless. You have to read every chapter but the tests would hyperfocus on small sections from the reading. There are 5 tests, 6 quizzes, and 5 discussion boards. The lowest grade from each one is dropped which is nice
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Very sweet and caring, but strict on due dates. Tests/quizzes can be very difficult if you dont completely understand everything in the chapter. Does give extra points on tests if they arent fair. 5 exams, 6 quizzes, 5 discussion posts, and SONA point required. She can be unorganized sometimes but shes always available to answer questions.

0/10, we are assigned to read text book pages and the entire hour of class is just spent reiterating the already covered material, you would think with this amount of reiteration that the tests would be applicable to the readings but its not, the tests are difficult and done with a webcam browser lockdown. stay away from this professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Very nice professor, but if you dont read the textbook these tests will be very difficult for you.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Whittlesey is very sweet and caring, but her quizzes and tests don't always line up with the material she presents, & that is very frustrating. Overall her class is easy, just take the notes. There's a few quizzes and tests and 1 SONA project. You study the notes and the test is real work applicable which is different than knowing PowerPoints
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Whittlesey makes the test notoriously hard for absolutely no reason , unless you commit everything in the book to memory you are doomed to fail. While the quizzes and assignments are easy the test are brutal and I've never gotten higher than a 65%, if you can avoid it do not take her class!

Professor Whittlesey is super kind and her class is very organized. Her emails are very clear and she keeps you up to date on any upcoming due dates or assignments. Her tests can be challenging since there's a lot of information to study, but some of the tests are open note which is super helpful.
Straight online course. Laid out material and easy access to assignments
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly, Professor Whittlesey is not getting enough credit. Maybe she changed something, idk. I took this course online and haven't made below a 90 on a test yet. She is very clear, organized, and understanding. Gives you everything you need to do well in her class.

Dr. Whittlesey is amazing. She is very clear with what she expects from her class, and is very open to answering questions until the topic is understood. She's quick to answer emails, and provides more than enough content to ensure her students success!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Shes a very nice lady but her lectures make no sense. I studied her study guide for the first test and failed so hard along with the rest of the class. All of our test had a failing average even with the curve she did. I can see she cares about psych but she doesnt do a great job teaching it. Read the book if you want to do good and the ppts.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Dr. Whittlesey is a VERY nice woman. Despite this, her test are very difficult even if you study. She does curve every test but you really have to study the textbook AND ppts. (she puts them online.) Attendance is only counted by her pop quizzes but she tells you when youre going to have a pop quiz. You can tell she truly cares about psychology.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She is a very, very nice lady. If you only study the class notes you will definitely fail tests. In order to succeed, you HAVE to read the textbook on your own, take notes as you read, and study those. This class is very doable if you put in the work. Every test has been curved and they are all application questions. She gives heads up for pop quiz
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Awful professor. Truly one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She's not rude, just clueless. Goes over tests (which are nearly impossible to do well on) in class and we frequently prove her wrong on what she chose as the "right answer." And she doesn't even make her own tests, so she frequently curves because we fail every test. Awful experience.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She is not put together. She usually gives notice when the pop quiz will be. All of her powerpoints are literal notes straight from the online textbook so attending class is pointless. Her tests are awful We have 5 exams and she has curved each one because she realized she messed it up. Not the worst but you do need to study hard for tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Her test are nothing like what she teaches. She is obviously a very smart woman but she even told us she isnt a teacher. Her test are almost impossible to pass, and you never know what will be on it. Her study guides are useless considering she doesnt even make her own test. Yes, she did tell us this.
